content: This glossary provides players with detailed rules for Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition, organized by topic. Players are encouraged to use the index on page 32 to find specific topics within the glossary.

additional.title: GLOSSARY

content: During the action phase, each player takes a turn in initiative order. During a player’s turn, they perform a single action. After each player has taken a turn, player turns begin again in initiative order. This process continues until all players have passed.

additional.title: ACTION PHASE

content: three types of actions: a strategic action, a tactical action, or a component action.

additional.title: If a player cannot perform an action, they must pass.

content: perform additional actions during that action phase.
• During a turn that a player passes, they can resolve transactions and “at the start of your turn” abilities.
• A player that has passed can still resolve the secondary ability of other players’ strategy cards.
• It is possible for a player to perform multiple, consecutive actions during an action phase if all other players have passed during that action phase.

content: game. After the custodians token is removed from Mecatol Rex, the agenda phase is added to each game round. To resolve the agenda phase, players perform the following steps:

content: following these steps in order: i. REVEAL AGENDA: The speaker draws one agenda card from the top of the agenda deck and reads it aloud to all players, including all of its possible outcomes. ii. VOTE: Each player, starting with the player to the left of the speaker and continuing clockwise, can cast votes for an outcome of the current agenda. iii.RESOLVE OUTCOME: Players tally each vote that was cast and resolve the outcome that received the most votes.

content: RELATED TOPICS: Asteroid Field, Gravity Rift, Movement, Nebula, Supernova, System Tiles 10 ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE (UNIT ABILITY) A unit with the “Anti-Fighter Barrage” ability may be able to destroy an opponent’s fighters at the onset of a space battle. During the “Anti-Fighter Barrage” step of the first round of space combat, players perform the following steps:
subtree.id: RELATED TOPICS

content: combat that has the “Anti-Fighter Barrage” ability; this is called an anti-fighter barrage roll. A hit is produced for each die roll that is equal to or greater than the unit’s anti-fighter barrage value.
• A unit’s “Anti-Fighter Barrage” ability is presented along with a unit’s attributes on faction sheets and unit upgrade technology cards.
• The “Anti-Fighter Barrage” ability is displayed as “AntiFighter Barrage X (xY).” The X is the minimum value needed for a die to produce a hit, and Y is the number of dice rolled.
• Game effects that reroll, modify, or otherwise affect combat rolls do not affect anti-fighter barrage rolls.

additional.title: STEP 1—Each player rolls dice for each of their units in the

content: fighters in the active system for each hit their opponent’s antifighter barrage roll produced.
• If a player has to assign more hits than they have fighters in the active system, the excess hits have no effect.

content: RELATED TOPICS: Producing Units, Ships 15 BOMBARDMENT (UNIT ABILITY) A unit with the “Bombardment” ability may be able to destroy another player’s ground forces during an invasion. During the “Bombardment” step, players perform the following steps:
subtree.id: RELATED TOPICS

content: units that has a “Bombardment” ability will bombard. Then, that player rolls dice for each of those units; this is called a bombardment roll. A hit is produced for each die roll that is equal to or greater than the unit’s “Bombardment” value.
• A unit’s “Bombardment” ability is presented along with a unit’s attributes on faction sheets and unit upgrade technology cards.

• The “Bombardment” ability is displayed as “Bombardment X (xY).” The X is the minimum value needed for a die to produce a hit, and Y is the number of dice rolled. Not all “Bombardment” abilities have a (Y) value; a bombardment roll for such a unit consists of one die.
• Game effects that reroll, modify, or otherwise affect combat rolls do not affect bombardment rolls.
• Multiple planets in a system may be bombarded, but a player must declare which planet a unit is bombarding before making a bombardment roll.
• The L1Z1X’s “Harrow” ability does not affect the L1Z1X player’s own ground forces.
• Planets that contain a unit with the “Planetary Shield” ability cannot be bombarded.

• A unit’s “Space Cannon” ability is presented along with a unit’s attributes on faction sheets and unit upgrade technology cards.

• “Space Cannon” is displayed as “Space Cannon X (xY).” The X is the minimum value needed for a die to produce a hit, and Y is the number of dice rolled. Not all “Space Cannon” abilities are accompanied by a (Y) value; a space cannon roll for such a unit consists of one die.

• If a player has a PDS unit upgrade technology, they can use the “Space Cannon” ability of their PDS units that are in systems that are adjacent to the active system. The hits are still assigned to units in the active system.

• During the first round of a combat, “start of combat” and “start of combat round” effects occur during the same timing window.

• If the defender announces a retreat, the attacker cannot announce a retreat during that combat round.
• A player cannot announce a retreat if there is not at least one eligible system to retreat to.

content: they have in the active system; this is called a combat roll. If a unit’s combat roll produces a result that is equal to or greater than that unit’s combat value, that result produces a hit.
• If a unit’s combat value contains two or more burst icons, the player rolls one die for each burst icon instead.

• If a player has ships that have different combat values in the active system, that player rolls these dice separately. - First, that player should roll all dice for units with a combat value of “1.” Then, that player should roll all dice for units with combat value of “2,” and then “3,” continuing in numerical order until that player has rolled dice for each of their ships. - The player counts each hit their combat rolls produce. The total number of hits produced will destroy units during the “Assign Hits” step. - If a player has an ability that rerolls a die or affects a die after it is rolled, that player must resolve such an ability immediately after rolling all of their dice. 24 - The attacker makes all of their combat rolls during this step before the defender. This procedure is important for abilities that allow a player to reroll an opponent’s die.

content: step 2, and there is still an eligible system for their units to retreat to, they must retreat.
• If a player announced a retreat during the “Announce Retreats” step, but their opponent has no ships remaining in the system, the combat immediately ends and the retreat does not occur.

• To retreat, a player takes all of their ships in the combat and moves them to a single system that is adjacent to the active system. That player’s fighters and ground forces in the space area of the active system that are unable to move or be transported are destroyed.

• The system that a player’s units retreat to must contain one or more of that player’s units, a planet they control, or both. Additionally, the system cannot contain ships controlled by another player.

• If any of a player’s units successfully retreat and are moved into an adjacent system, that player must place a command token from their reinforcements in the system to which their units retreated. If that system already contains one of their command tokens, that player does not place an additional token there. If the player has no command tokens in their reinforcements, that player must use one from their command sheet instead.

content: The text of the Naalu flagship “Matriarch” should read as follows: “During an invasion in this system, you may commit fighters to planets as if they were ground forces. When combat ends, return those units to the space area.”

additional.title: MATRIARCH

content: The text of the Xxcha promissory note “Political Favor” should read as follows: “When an agenda is revealed: Remove 1 token from the Xxcha player’s strategy pool and return it to their reinforcements. Then, discard the revealed agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead. Then, return this card to the Xxcha player.

additional.title: POLITICAL FAVOR

content: The text of the “Unstable Planet” action card should read as follows: “Action: Choose 1 hazardous planet. Exhaust that planet and destroy up to 3 infantry on it.”

additional.title: UNSTABLE PLANET

content: The text of the “Veto” action card should read as follows: “When an agenda is revealed: Discard that agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.”

additional.title: VETO

content: This section contains answers to frequently asked questions.

additional.title: FAQ
GENERAL

content: A: Yes, the “0” face is a “10” result.

additional.title: Q: Are the “0” faces of the ten-sided dice included with the game intended to represent the result of a “10”?

content: A: If neither side has the potential to win, the attacker must retreat. If they cannot retreat, their units in the combat are destroyed.

additional.title: Q: How should a space combat be resolved if it is mathematically impossible for either side to win—for example, certain configurations of ships using the “Non-Euclidean Shielding” and “Duranium Armor” technologies in concert?

content: A: Yes, fighters can block ship movement (this was added as a correction in the Living Rules Reference version 1.1).

additional.title: Q: Can fighters block ship movement?

content: A: No. “Plasma Scoring” only grants one additional die for each “Bombardment” or “Space Cannon” roll, and the unit benefiting from this technology must be decided before rolling.

additional.title: Q: Does each unit participating in “Bombardment” or “Space Cannon” roll an additional die for the “Plasma Scoring” technology?

content: A: No. “X-89 Bacterial Weapon” is not part of bombardment, so it is not prevented by “Planetary Shield.” 35

additional.title: Q: Does “Planetary Shield” prevent the use of “X-89 Bacterial Weapon”?

content: A: Yes. Any effect that moves a ship allows that ship to transport units in its system, if it has available capacity.

additional.title: Q: Can units be picked up and transported off of planets when using abilities that move ships, such as the “Skilled Retreat” action card or “Foresight” faction ability?

content: A: Yes. This information is kept hidden by default, but it is permissible to reveal it to another player or players as a strategic option.

additional.title: Q: Can you intentionally reveal hidden information to another player, such as an action card from your hand or your secret objective?

content: A: When those infantry would be placed on a home planet, they are returned to that player’s reinforcements instead.

additional.title: Q: What happens to infantry that would be placed on a planet in any player’s home system by the effect of the “Infantry II” unit upgrade technology if that player does not own any planets in their home system?

content: A: Yes. For example, a promissory note with “At the start of your turn:” timing may be immediately played if the transaction occurred within the “start of turn” timing window.

additional.title: Q: Can a card (such as a promissory note) with a specified timing of a certain window that is acquired from a transaction during that window be played immediately?

content: A: They must resolve this effect during the resolution of the secondary ability as normal, but they do not have to spend a command token to do so.

additional.title: Q: When the player resolving the “Trade” strategy card selects another player to resolve the “Trade” secondary ability for free, does the player resolving the effect for free do so during the execution of the primary ability or the secondary ability?

content: A: Yes. Even if that player gains zero commodities when their commodities are refreshed, their “Trade Agreement” may still be played against them.

additional.title: Q: If a player would refresh their commodities but already has the maximum amount, can another player still play that player’s “Trade Agreement” promissory note against them?

content: A: No. “Neural Motivator” gives only one action card in addition to the standard status phase draw. It is not triggered additional times by other abilities. The Yssaril’s “Scheming” ability, however, is triggered each time that action cards are drawn.

additional.title: Q: Does the “Neural Motivator” technology give an additional action card for both the standard status phase draw as well as the “Minister of Policy” agenda? What about the Yssaril’s “Scheming” faction ability?

content: A: No. The “Political Secret” promissory note only prevents the use of faction abilities that a player must choose to use.

additional.title: Q: Does the “Political Secret” promissory note disable passive/ mandatory faction abilities, such as the Barony of Letnev’s “Armada” faction ability, when it is used against that player?

content: A: No. The “Political Secret” promissory note does not prevent a player from using faction-specific technology, nor does it prevent the use of other abilities, such as those from agendas that a player might own.

additional.title: Q: Does the “Political Secret” promissory note prevent a player from using faction-specific technology?

content: A: No. In both situations, the “Space Cannon” ability did not destroy the last ship in the system, so the objective is not fulfilled.

additional.title: Q: Can the “Turn Their Fleets to Dust” objective be fulfilled by using a “Direct Hit” action card or by destroying a unit with capacity and allowing transported fighters to be removed as a result?

content: A: The “Plasma Scoring” technology adds one die for each space planet’s “Space Cannon” roll.

additional.title: Q: If a player has multiple planets with PDS that are being invaded in a single system, does the “Plasma Scoring” technology add one die to each planet’s space cannon roll or for only one planet’s space cannon roll?
PRODUCTION

content: A: Yes, a unit that is produced must always be paid for.

additional.title: Q: When an ability other than “Production” allows you to produce one or more units, do you have to pay for the units produced?

content: A: No, “Sarween Tools” is only used with the “Production” ability.

additional.title: Q: When producing a unit with an ability other than “Production,” does the price reduction from the “Sarween Tools” technology apply?
AGENDAS

content: A: No. The agenda is exhausted, not the planet.

additional.title: Q: When a “Research Team” agenda that is attached to a planet is used to ignore a prerequisite, is the planet exhausted?

content: A: No. A vote of zero is the same as abstaining; that player gains no positive or negative effects of voting “For” or “Against” on an agenda if they contributed zero votes.

additional.title: Q: Can a player cast zero votes “For” or “Against” on an agenda instead of abstaining, in order to take advantage of effects associated with that option?

content: A: No. “Enforced Travel Ban” does not prevent “Space Cannon” usage.

additional.title: Q: Does the “Enforced Travel Ban” agenda prevent “Space Cannon” usage through wormholes?

content: A: The secret objective remains in play; it is no longer a public objective and cannot by scored by any additional players, but it does not count toward the secret objective total of the player who originally owned it.

additional.title: Q: If the “Classified Document Leaks” agenda is discarded, what happens?

content: A: Yes, the law that is being voted on because of “Miscount Disclosed” remains in play during the revote.

additional.title: Q: During a revote initiated by the “Miscount Disclosed” agenda, does the law that is being voted on remain active and in play?

content: A: No. Only the Creuss treats those systems as adjacent.

additional.title: Q: If there is an ‘A’ wormhole on Mecatol Rex when the “Ixthian Artifact” agenda causes units in adjacent systems to be destroyed, does the Quantum Entanglement ability cause the Ghost of Creuss faction to lose units in a system that contains a ‘B’ wormhole?

content: A: Units destroyed by “Ixthian Artifact” are destroyed simultaneously.

additional.title: Q: When units are destroyed by the “Ixthian Artifact” agenda, in what order are they destroyed?

content: A: Yes. It is a new agenda and thus the effect of the player’s “Political Secret” is ended.

additional.title: Q: If a player’s “Political Secret” promissory note is used against them, but that agenda is subsequently discarded by an effect such as the “Veto” action card, can that player vote and use faction abilities on the new agenda?

content: A: Both agendas may target the same planet. However, in that situation, infantry cannot be placed on the elected planet, so it remains under the control of its original owner.

additional.title: Q: Can the “Colonial Redistribution” agenda elect a planet that is already the target of “Demilitarized Zone,” and if so, can the chosen player place infantry to take control of the planet?

content: A: No, the player who gained a victory point from these agendas can only lose that point through the effect stated on the card. If the card is discarded in any other way, such as the “Repeal Law” action card, the point is not lost.

additional.title: Q: When the “Holy Planet of Ixth,” “Shard of the Throne,” or “The Crown of Emphidia” agendas are repealed, does the player who owns them lose a victory point?

content: A: Yes. Performing any action is the trigger for the remainder of the “Minister of War” agenda card’s ability.

additional.title: Q: Is the trigger for the “Minister of War” agenda card’s ability “performing an action”?
ACTION CARDS

content: A: No, “Skilled Retreat” is not a retreat and cannot be canceled in this way.

additional.title: Q: Is the “Skilled Retreat” action card considered to be a retreat, and can it be canceled by the action card “Intercept?”

content: A: No, “Courageous to the End” does not produce hits.

additional.title: Q: Can “Sustain Damage” be used against the “Courageous to the End” action card?

content: A: Yes. Because the two “Direct Hit” cards are targeting different targets, this is allowed.

additional.title: Q: Can two “Direct Hit” action cards be played by the same player during the same round of combat against different targets?

content: A: Yes. Because each of the “Shields Holding” cards are targeting different sets of hits (one set against player A and one set against player B), it is legal to play both cards.

additional.title: Q: During space combat, can each player play a “Shields Holding” action card to cancel hits against their own units, even though the cards are being played during the same timing window?

content: A: Yes. “Shields Holding” may be used to cancel hits that are produced by these abilities.

additional.title: Q: Can the “Shields Holding” action card be used to cancel hits from abilities that occur during combat, such as “Ambush,” “Dimensional Splicer,” and “Devotion?”

content: A: Yes. “Direct Hit” can be used to follow up hits that are assigned by “Ambush,” “Dimensional Splicer,” “Devotion,” and other similar abilities.

additional.title: Q: Can the “Direct Hit” action cards be played when a ship uses “Sustain Damage” to cancel a hit produced by one of your abilities?

content: A: No. The “Distinguished Councilor” action card can only be played after you vote during the “Vote” step of resolving an agenda.

additional.title: Q: Does an effect that casts “additional votes,” such as the “Bribery” action card, create a timing window for playing the “Distinguished Councilor” action card?

content: A: The “Sabotage” action can be played after card targets (such as units, planets, systems, cards, outcomes, or players) have been decided on, but must be played before any effects have been resolved, votes have been cast, or any dice have been rolled.

additional.title: Q: When during the action card playing process is a “Sabotage” card played?

content: A: No. “Lucky Shot” and other similar effects can only be used against other player’s units and planets.

additional.title: Q: Can abilities that destroy units, such as the “Lucky Shot” action card, be used by a player against their own units or planets?

content: A: Yes to both. A player may play multiple rider action cards on a single agenda, and they may be played on opposing outcomes.

additional.title: Q: Can multiple rider action cards be played by the same player on a single agenda? If so, can they be played on different outcomes?

content: A: Yes. The cruiser must already be in the activated system.

additional.title: Q: When playing the “Upgrade” action card, does the cruiser already have to be present in the active system?

content: A: No. “Experimental Battlestation” operates in the same timing window as “Space Cannon Offense,” can only target the active player’s ships, and can only be resolved if ships actually move into the active system.

additional.title: Q: Can the “Experimental Battlestation” action card be used if no ships move into the active system, or against ships that do not belong to the active player?

content: A: Yes. The Nekro player, or a player who cannot vote due to another effect, can still play rider action cards.

additional.title: Q: Can a player who cannot vote (such as the Nekro Virus) play rider action cards?

content: A: Yes, even if the speaker cannot vote, or chooses not to vote, the “Bribery” action card (or any effect with the timing window of “after the speaker votes”) can still be played after the timing window in which the speaker would have cast votes.

additional.title: Q: If the speaker does not vote, can the “Bribery” action card still be played?
THE ARBOREC

content: A: No, the “Warfare” secondary ability can only be used to trigger the “Production” ability of space docks, and thus cannot be used by the Arborec to produce additional infantry.

additional.title: Q: Can the secondary ability of the “Warfare” strategy card be used to trigger the “Production” ability of the Arborec’s Letani Warriors?

content: A: Yes. The “Duha Menaimon” can only be used to produce units when it is in a system at the moment it is activated.

additional.title: Q: Does the Arborec flagship (The “Duha Menaimon”) need to be in a system when it is activated to resolve its ability?

content: A: Yes. Production value is totaled when the “Production” ability of units in a system is used.

additional.title: Q: Can the “Production” abilities of multiple Arborec “Letani Warriors” in a system be combined to allow the production of two infantry for one resource?
THE NEKRO VIRUS

content: A: No, printed faction units are not technologies, and thus are ineligible targets for “Valefar Assimilator.”

additional.title: Q: Can the Nekro Virus use the “Valefar Assimilator” technologies on printed faction units, such as the Embers of Muaat’s Prototype War Sun I?

content: A: No. Infantry that are committed to the space combat due to the effects of “The Alastor” continue to participate until the end of the combat, even if “The Alastor” is destroyed.

additional.title: Q: Do infantry involved in a space combat due to the effects of “The Alastor” flagship cease participation in combat if the Alastor is destroyed?

content: A: Yes. Only the faction-specific unit upgrade technology will be in effect, but should the Nekro lose the faction-specific upgrade technology that is being copied by the “Valefar Assimilator,” they would revert to the standard unit upgrade technology that was previously inactive.

additional.title: Q: Can the Nekro Virus have both a standard and a faction-specific unit upgrade of the same type?

content: A: No. Only one upgrade of a given type counts toward those objectives.

additional.title: Q: If the Nekro Virus owns multiple unit upgrade technologies of the same type, such as “Dreadnought II” and “Exotrireme II,” does each one count toward the “Develop Weaponry” and “Revolutionize Warfare” objectives?

content: A: Yes. These infantry may be used to resolve “Assault Cannon.”

additional.title: Q: Do infantry involved in a space combat via the effects of “The Alastor” flagship count toward the ships required to use the “Assault Cannon” technology?

content: A: Yes. The “Salai Sai Corian” would get one additional die per infantry.

additional.title: Q: Does the Winnu “Salai Sai Corian” flagship get additional dice for infantry participating in a fight due to the Nekro “Alastor” flagship?
THE EMIRATES OF HACAN

content: A: As long as the active player is involved in the transaction, either player may suggest the opening of negotiations during either player’s turn.

additional.title: Q: Does the Hacan player have to initiate negotiations to perform a transaction with a player who is not their neighbor?
THE XXCHA KINGDOM

content: A: Yes, a planet is treated as being adjacent to its own system.

additional.title: Q: Can the Xxcha use the “Peace Accords” faction ability from one planet to another planet in the same system?
THE GHOSTS OF CREUSS

content: A: Yes, the promissory note does not require that the “Wormhole Generator” technology is researched.

additional.title: Q: Can the Creuss Promissory note still be used if the Creuss have not researched “Wormhole Generator”?

content: A: Yes, “Light/Wave Deflector” allows a player other than the Ghosts of Creuss to move their fleet through the “Hil Colish’s” system into the Creuss home system or the Creuss Gate system.

additional.title: Q: Can the “Light/Wave Deflector” technology be used to move through a wormhole created by the Ghosts of Creuss’ “Hil Colish” flagship?

content: A: No, the wormhole ceases to exist when the “Hil Colish” is returned to reinforcements.

additional.title: Q: If the “Hil Colish” moves before other ships and is returned to reinforcements by a gravity rift, can other ships still use its delta wormhole to reach the active system?
THE NAALU COLLECTIVE

content: A: No. The Naalu fighters return to the space area when ground combat ends. If no Naalu ground forces are present, the combat is considered to be a draw, and the Naalu do not gain control of the planet during the “Establish Control” step.

additional.title: Q: Does “The Matriarch” flagship allow the Naalu to gain control of a planet using only fighters?

content: A: No. Because the combat ends in a draw, the “Dacxive Animators” ability is not triggered.

additional.title: Q: Using “The Matriarch” flagship in combination with the “Dacxive Animators” technology, can the Naalu gain control of a planet using only fighters?

content: A: No. The Naalu “0” token stays with the Naalu or the faction that gained the token through the “Gift of Prescience” promissory note and is placed on any of that player’s strategy cards.

additional.title: Q: Does the Naalu “0” token move with the strategy card it is placed on if the card is exchanged with or taken by another player?
THE CLAN OF SAAR

content: A: Yes, “Chaos Mapping” can be used on the turn that a player passes.

additional.title: Q: Can the Clan of Saar’s “Chaos Mapping” faction-specific technology be used on the turn that the Saar player passes?

content: A: No, “Floating Factories” cannot be the target of PDS fire.

additional.title: Q: Can the Clan of Saar’s “Floating Factories” trigger Space Cannon Offense or be assigned hits produced by PDS units?
THE MENTAK COALITION

content: A: No. Without war sun technology, they cannot produce a war sun, even using “Salvage Operations.”

additional.title: Q: Can the Mentak Coalition use the “Salvage Operations” faction-specific technology to produce a war sun that was destroyed if they do not personally have war sun technology?

content: A: Yes, even though the units are technically different, they share the flagship unit type.

additional.title: Q: Can the Mentak Coalition use the “Salvage Operations” factionspecific technology to produce their own flagship after destroying an opponent’s flagship?

content: A: No, the infantry do not count as ships once the combat is over.

additional.title: Q: Can the Mentak Coalition use the “Salvage Operations” factionspecific technology to produce infantry after a combat against the Nekro Virus flagship “The Alastor” in which Nekro Virus infantry were treated like ships and were subsequently destroyed?

content: A: Yes, even in the case of “Quantum Entanglement” only being active from the Creuss’ point of view, because the ‘neighbor’ status is active as a result of the ability, the Mentak may use their “Pillage” in these situations.

additional.title: Q: Can the Mentak Coalition use the “Pillage” faction ability to steal trade goods when they are neighbors with another faction as a result of the “Lazax Gate Folding” faction technology or “Quantum Entanglement” faction ability?

content: A: Yes. The Mentak can trigger “Pillage” each time the Saar gain control of a planet, if all the conditions of “Pillage” are met.

additional.title: Q: Can the Mentak Coalition use the “Pillage” faction ability for each time the Saar gain a trade good from the “Scavenge” faction ability in a single turn, provided that the other requirements are met?
